intro: Neuwiedia zollingeri var. annamensis, commonly known as the Annamensis Neuwiedia, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. This variant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in shaded, humid environments, often in dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
